thread.title: Leyton Orient are England's most pitiful side in 2017 | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Leyton Orient are England's most pitiful side in 2017 | Daily Mail Online

author: Jeff Powell For The Daily Mail
title: Leyton Orient are England's most pitiful side in 2017 | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Never mind, either, that we can no longer scoff fish and chips from newspaper before the match, now that the chippies in the High Road have been overrun by kebab shops. Things were looking up for the second oldest Football League club in London. (Fulham, if you must know.) Never, in the 112 years since the O’s joined these hallowed ranks, have they suffered the ignominy of exile to the nether regions of the English game. Never. Orient, London's second oldest club, looked to have turned a corner in recent weeks Captain Paul McCallum looks dejected as Orient lost the game at the death So might the horrors of ultimate relegation yet be avoided? We must have forgotten that this day’s visitors outrank us in the annals. Notts County are the most ancient club competing in a major professional league anywhere in the world. The oldest die hardest. They took the lead in the first half. Against the run of play, of course. We equalised. Come on you 0’s. They bundled in a second. Lucky, of course. Although it would help if we had a decent ‘keeper. We drew level, again. Richly deserved, naturally. Only minutes to go but still time for them to drive home the winner. Oh, you O’ s. The catastrophe at Leyton Orient has a name. An Italian name. Francesco Becchetti. Can this really be happening? Alright, we enjoyed only one season in the First (now Premier) Division. But we did beat Manchester United and, above all, West Ham, before going straight back down. And we once came back from two down to beat Chelsea in the fifth round of the FA Cup in which, on another year, we reached the semi-final. ORIENT IN 2017
